metadata.Title: CVE-2023-26463 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - high.
metadata.Description:
strongSwan 5.9.8 and 5.9.9 potentially allows remote code execution because it uses a variable named "public" for two different purposes within the same function. There is initially incorrect access control, later followed by an expired pointer dereference. One attack vector is sending an untrusted client certificate during EAP-TLS. A server is affected only if it loads plugins that implement TLS-based EAP methods (EAP-TLS, EAP-TTLS, EAP-PEAP, or EAP-TNC). This is fixed in 5.9.10.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-26463` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

charon-cmd - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
charon-systemd - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
libcharon-extauth-plugins - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
libstrongswan - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
strongswan - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
strongswan-charon - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
strongswan-libcharon - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
strongswan-nm - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
strongswan-pki - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
strongswan-starter - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
strongswan-swanctl - 5.9.8-3ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> upstream: "Affected are strongSwan versions 5.9.8 and 5.9.9." introduced by 63fd718915b5 ("libtls: call create_public_enumerator() with key_type") fix is already in master

criterions.comment: strongswan package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.9.8-3ubuntu3').
